TopicTitle: did you know if you have enough disk space you can run kerbal on a chromebook ?

Articles.Content:
I write this using a low end samsung chromebook but theres a caveat it can run kerbal... without enabling dev mode

I completely forget how I managed this but I was able to install a linux gui and from there install the deb file for steam and well the rest is pretty simple from there. I don't actually have kerbal on here because:

1. not enough disk space

2. the speed the game would run at would be worse than a snail stuck in a glue trap; I would essentially be playing an interactive slideshow.

On 1/10/2022 at 1:54 AM, asap1 said:

I write this using a low end samsung chromebook but theres a caveat it can run kerbal... without enabling dev mode

I completely forget how I managed this but I was able to install a linux gui and from there install the deb file for steam and well the rest is pretty simple from there. I don't actually have kerbal on here because:

1. not enough disk space

2. the speed the game would run at would be worse than a snail stuck in a glue trap; I would essentially be playing an interactive slideshow. 

I would imagine running scatterer and EVE would be like looking at a picture
